Comments
May 4, 2022
Hellboy the Bellboy
He doesn't seem great, his powers are pretty bland and they don't interact well together. If damage switches a character's playstyle it's better to go from ranged to close because the opponent is most likely in your face. That being said, his printed damage value never goes below a 3 and he has three clicks of 4 damage. His blandness may be a benefit, because your opponent may overlook him like many (myself included) have.
March 1, 2022
pokolo
psy blast and charge isn't great together... maybe if he had been given a special speed that gave both charge and running shot to combo a little better... i think that hurts his playability overall

muel0017
[QUOTE=Goop;12178114]A bit overcosted for 75pts. Nothing really that special for him, probably should have been a common.[/QUOTE] Goop here expects every "good" figure to be under 50 points with better than average combat values. There is nothing wrong with the point value of this figure. He has above average stats most of his dial, the only stat that actually IS average is his 10 attack. Play this figure if you want and ignore him.
